gurmukhi: Byjo koaU dUq gH qy ilAwvY qwih ko ]
transliteration: Bhejo Ko( i)  Doot Grah Te Liaavai Taah(i) Ko||
translation: Some messenger may be sent to call him from his home.

gurmukhi: jIiqE ijn purhUq Buj bil jw ky Aimq hY ]122]
transliteration: Jeetio Jin Purhoot Bhuj Bal(i) Jaa Ke Amit Hai||122||
translation: He had conquered Indra with his unlimited strength of arms. 122.

gurmukhi: sROxq ibMd pY dYq iek gieE krI Ardws ]
transliteration: Sraounat Bind Pai Dait Ik Gado Daroo Ardaas||
translation: A demon went to the house of Raktavija and requested;

gurmukhi: rwj bulwvq sBw mY byg clo iqh pws ]123]
transliteration: Raaj Bulaavat Sabhaa Mai Beg Chalo Tih Paas||123||
translation: “Thou hast been summoned in the royal court, appear before it very quickly.”123.

gurmukhi: rkq bIj niRp suMB ko kIno Awn pRnwm ]
transliteration: Rakat Booj Nrip Sounbh Ko Koono Aan Pranaam||
translation: Raktavija came and bowed in obeisance before the king.

gurmukhi: Asur sBw miD Bwau kir kihE krhu mm kwm ]124]
transliteration: Asur Sabhaa Madh(i) Bhaau Kar(i) Kahiodaroh Mam Kaam||124||
translation: With due veneration, he said in the court, “Tell me, what can I do?”124.

gurmukhi: sRauxq ibMd ko suMB insuMB bulwie bYTwie kY Awdru kIno ]
transliteration: Sraounat Bind Ko Sounbh Nisounbh Bulaae Baithaae Kai Aadar(u) Koono||
translation: Sumbh and Nisumbh called Raktavija in their presence and offered him a seat with respect.

gurmukhi: dY isr qwj bfy gjrwj su bwj dey irJvwie kY lIno ]
transliteration: Dai Sir Taaj Bade Gadraaj Su Baaj Dae Rijhvaae Kai Loono||
translation: He was the crown for his head and presented with elephants and horses, which he accepted with pleasure.

gurmukhi: pwn lY dYq khI ieh cMf ko ruMf kro Ab muMf ibhIno ]
transliteration: Paan Lai Dait Kahoo Eh Channd Ko Round Daro Ab Mounnd Bihoono||
translation: After taking the betel leaf, Raktavija said, “I shall immediately separate the head of Chandika from her trunk.”

gurmukhi: AYsy kihE iqn m`iD sBw niRp rIJ kY mYG AfMbr dIno ]125]
transliteration: Aise Kahio Tin Maddh(i) Sabhaa Nrip Roojh Kai Megh Adanbar Doono||125||
translation: When he said these words before the assembly, the king was pleased to award him a dreadful thundering trumpet and a canopy.125.

gurmukhi: sROxq ibMd ko sMuMB insuMB kihE qum jwhu mhwN dlu lY kY ]
transliteration: Sraounat Bind Ko Sounbh Nisounbh Kahio Toum Jaahu Mahaan Dal(u) Lai Kai||
translation: Sumbh and Nisumbh said, “Now go and take with you a huge army;

gurmukhi: Cwr kry grUey igr rwjih cMf pcwr hno blu kY kY ]
transliteration: Chhaad Dare Darooe Gir Raajah(i) Channd Pachaar Hano Bal(u) Kai Kai||
translation: “Reduce the great mountain of the goddess to dust and with all your strength challenge and kill her.”
